The only unsafe direction is UP, because it would move the head into the cell (1,5) which is currently occupied by our own body segment – moving directly backward into your own body kills you.  

DOWN, LEFT, and RIGHT are all on the board and do not intersect any current snake segment.  
- DOWN moves the head toward the reachable apple at (1,0) while keeping a clear path ahead.  
- After moving DOWN, the new head at (1,3) will still have open space in all three other directions, preserving future options.  
- The opponent’s head is far away at (7,8), so a head‑on collision is unlikely this turn.  

Thus DOWN maximizes progress toward an apple and maintains flexibility for subsequent moves.
